<p>We believe that you shouldn&#8217;t have to hire a developer to create a WordPress contact form. That&#8217;s why we built <a href="https://wpforms.com/?utm_source=wprepo&amp;utm_medium=link&amp;utm_campaign=liteplugin" title="WPForms" rel="friend nofollow ugc">WPForms</a>, a drag &amp; drop WordPress form builder that&#8217;s EASY and POWERFUL.</p>
<p>WPForms allows you to create beautiful contact forms, feedback form, subscription forms, payment forms, and other types of forms for your site in minutes, not hours!</p>
<p>At WPForms, user experience is our #1 priority. Our pre-built form templates and workflows make WPForms the most beginner friendly contact form plugin in the market.</p>
<p>The WPForms Challenge guides you through creating your first form in under 5 minutes. We walk you through using the form builder all the way to adding a form to a page on your site! WPForms includes integrations for popular page builders like the WordPress Block Editor (Gutenberg), Classic Editor, Elementor, and Divi making the whole process seamless.</p>
<p>WPForms is a 100% mobile responsive contact form solution, so your contact forms will always look great on all devices (mobile, tablet, laptop, and desktop).</p>
<p>WPForms&#8217; contact forms are also highly optimized for web and server performance because we understand the importance of speed when it comes to SEO, marketing, and conversion. We can honestly say that WPForms is one of the fastest WordPress contact form builder plugins in the world.</p>
<blockquote>
<p><strong>WPForms Pro</strong><br />
  This plugin is the lite version of the WPForms Pro plugin that comes with all the contact form features you will ever need including email subscription forms, multi-page contact forms, file uploads, conditional logic, payment integrations, form templates, and tons more. <a href="https://wpforms.com/?utm_source=wprepo&amp;utm_medium=link&amp;utm_campaign=liteplugin" title="WPForms" rel="friend nofollow ugc">Click here to purchase the best premium WordPress contact form plugin now!</a></p>
</blockquote>
<p>We took the pain out of creating contact forms and made it easy. Here&#8217;s why smart business owners, designers, and developers love WPForms, and you will too!</p>
<p><span class="embed-youtube" style="text-align:center; display: block;"><iframe class='youtube-player' width='640' height='360' src='https://www.youtube.com/embed/eiQ3viAGung?version=3&#038;rel=0&#038;showsearch=0&#038;showinfo=1&#038;iv_load_policy=1&#038;fs=1&#038;hl=en-US&#038;autohide=2&#038;wmode=transparent' allowfullscreen='true' style='border:0;' sandbox='allow-scripts allow-same-origin allow-popups allow-presentation'></iframe></span></p>
<h4>Drag &amp; Drop Contact Form Builder</h4>
<p>We were tired of the bloated and buggy contact form builder plugins. That&#8217;s why we built WPForms to adapt to your workflow and allow you to create custom contact forms in minutes. By using our easy to use <a href="https://wpforms.com/features/drag-drop-online-form-builder/?utm_source=wprepo&amp;utm_medium=link&amp;utm_campaign=liteplugin" rel="friend nofollow ugc">drag and drop online form builder</a>, you can easily add custom form fields, rearrange them, and basically create a complete contact form in 5 minutes or less.</p>
<p>But don&#8217;t just take our word. See what one of the WordPress experts are saying:</p>
<blockquote>
<p>WPForms is by far the <strong>easiest form plugin to use</strong>. My clients love WPForms and it&#8217;s one of the few plugins they can use without any training. As a developer I appreciate how fast, modern, clean and extensible it is.<br />
  Bill Erickson &#8211; Expert WordPress Consultant</p>
</blockquote>
<h4>Pre-built Form Templates</h4>
<p>Building contact forms in WordPress can be time consuming. Why?</p>
<p>Because every other WordPress contact form builder plugin requires you to build your contact form from scratch. The truth is it&#8217;s often not necessary to create a contact form completely from scratch unless you really want to.</p>
<p>Whether you&#8217;re looking to create a simple contact form, marketing form, request a quote form, donation form, payment order form, registration form, or a subscription form, we have a form template for you inside our contact form builder.</p>
<p>WPForms comes with <a href="https://wpforms.com/features/form-templates/?utm_source=wprepo&amp;utm_medium=link&amp;utm_campaign=liteplugin" rel="friend nofollow ugc">pre-built form templates</a> to help you save time. You can add, remove, or re-arrange fields as necessary.</p>
<p>See <a href="https://wpforms.com/demo/?utm_source=wprepo&amp;utm_medium=link&amp;utm_campaign=liteplugin" rel="friend nofollow ugc">100+ Pre-Made WPForms Form Template Demo</a></p>
<h4>Mobile Ready, SEO Friendly and Optimized for Speed</h4>
<p>WPForms&#8217; contact forms are 100% responsive and mobile-friendly by default. We also optimized every query on the front-end and the back-end to ensure maximum speed &#8211; Yes, WPForms is one of the fastest WordPress contact form plugin.</p>
<p>You can embed your contact form on any page with optimized title and description. With the speed and proper formatting, WPForms is also one of the most SEO friendly contact form plugin.</p>
<h4>All the Fields &amp; Features that You Need to Succeed</h4>
<p>From star ratings to file uploads to multi-page contact forms with progress bar, we have all the fields you need.</p>
<p>You can easily integrate your contact forms with an email marketing service or collect payments for bookings and orders. WPForms allows you to do it all.</p>
<p>The best part is, you can do it all without hiring a developer.</p>
<p>See what one business owner has to say about WPForms&#8217; contact form:</p>
<blockquote>
<p>As a business owner, time is my most valuable asset. WPForms allow me to create smart contact forms with just a few clicks. With their pre-built form templates and the drag &amp; drop builder, I can create a new form that works in less than 2 minutes without writing a single line of code. Well worth the investment.<br />
  David Henzel &#8211; Co-founder of MaxCDN</p>
</blockquote>
<h4>Surveys &amp; Polls</h4>
<p>Along with contact form, you can also use WPForms to create surveys and polls.</p>
<p>Our <a href="https://wpforms.com/addons/surveys-and-polls-addon/?utm_source=wprepo&amp;utm_medium=link&amp;utm_campaign=liteplugin" rel="friend nofollow ugc">WordPress Survey plugin addon</a> comes with smart survey fields including likert scale, star ratings, multiple choice, Net Promoter Score (NPS), and more, so you can create custom survey forms like Survey Monkey (without the high costs).</p>
<p>WPForms offer the best-in class survey reporting. You can use our interactive reports to customize the graphs, export them for your presentations, and even display the aggregate results to your users.</p>
<p>The best part about WPForms survey reports is that it can retroactively work on any old contact form or feedback survey contact form created with WPForms.</p>
<p>Thousands of businesses love WPForms surveys for creating employee feedback form, customer feedback form, online petition form, and more.</p>
<p>You can also use the surveys &amp; polls addon to easily create a poll on your site. To save you time when creating a user poll, we have added a built-in poll forms template. Our poll feature offers real-time reports, so you can share poll results with the user immediately after they submit their vote.</p>
<p>Just like the contact form, you can embed your surveys and polls inside any post, page, or widget area in WordPress.</p>
<h4>Membership and Default WordPress Forms</h4>
<p>Aside from building simple contact forms which every WordPress site needs, WPForms also helps you create better default WordPress forms.</p>
<p>For example, you can use WPForms to create custom WordPress login forms and custom WordPress user registration forms which are great for <a href="https://www.wpbeginner.com/wp-tutorials/ultimate-guide-to-creating-a-wordpress-membership-site/" rel="nofollow ugc">membership sites</a>.</p>
<p>For membership sites, you can also use WPForms to create a password-protected contact form or even a members only contact form which is restricited to logged-in users only.</p>
<p>Even if you&#8217;re not using a WordPress membership plugin, you can use WPForms to create membership registration forms, online RSVP forms, and other address book contact forms.</p>
<p>Bloggers and publishers can use our WordPress post submission forms to accept guest posts, testimonials contact form to collect testiomnials, and partnership agreement forms to grow their business.</p>
<h4>Payment Form, Donation Form, Booking Form, and More</h4>
<p>While WPForms started out as a contact form plugin, it has evolved into a powerful custom forms solution that you can use to create a payment form, donation form, registration form, online booking form, mobile form, and basically any type of custom form you need.</p>
<p>WPForms integrates with both PayPal and Stripe, so you can easily create a credit card payment form to accept payments on your website. If you&#8217;re using SSL, then you can use our Stripe Payment form to accept credit card payments. Alternatively you can use our PayPal payment form to make a donation form and accept payments online.</p>
<p>Aside from simple order forms, business owners also use WPForms to create custom product purchase forms, t-shirt order forms, online booking forms, and more.</p>
<p>We understand that sometimes you may need to create a contact form that require a signature. WPForms comes with a signature field to collect user signature on your WordPress forms or even create custom signature forms.</p>
<p>You can do all of this while still using the same easy-to-use contact form builder that&#8217;s loved by over 4 million users.</p>
<blockquote>
<p>I am so impressed with this plugin. I decided to give it a shot over some of the other form plugins, and I am so glad I did. It works well, is so easy to use and customize. The support is amazing on top of it all. I got the pro version because I was so pleased. Highly recommend.<br />
  Micky73 &#8211; WordPress user</p>
</blockquote>
<h4>Forms that are Optimized for Conversion and Results</h4>
<p>With our Form Pages addon, you can create distraction-free custom form landing pages like Google Forms and Wufoo right inside WordPress, so you can increase conversions without the high costs (<a href="https://wpforms.com/addons/form-pages-addon/?utm_source=wprepo&amp;utm_medium=link&amp;utm_campaign=liteplugin" rel="friend nofollow ugc">See Form Pages Demo</a>).</p>
<p>To improve form completion rate, we created Conversational Forms&reg; which helps you make your generic feedback form and other custom contact forms feel more human by adding an interactive form layout. Our conversational forms are similar to Typeform without the high subscription costs (<a href="https://wpforms.com/addons/conversational-forms-addon/?utm_source=wprepo&amp;utm_medium=link&amp;utm_campaign=liteplugin" rel="friend nofollow ugc">See Conversational Forms Demo</a>).</p>
<p>WPForms also has other conversion optimization features such as our smart form logic that lets you create dynamic contact forms where fields change based on user&#8217;s answer, multi-page contact forms with progress bar, and other advanced contact forms.</p>
<p>WPForms form analytics integration with MonsterInsights allow you to easily track your lead capture forms, newsletter signup forms, request a quote contact form, and other important forms on your site.</p>
<h4>Easy to Customize and Extend</h4>
<p>You can easily customize your contact forms with our section dividers, HTML blocks, and custom CSS.</p>
<p>If you&#8217;re using Elementor or Divi page builders our native integrations let you easily customize the style of your forms.</p>
<p>We also knew that our developer friends may want to extend simple contact forms further. That&#8217;s why WPForms come with tons of hooks and filters to create custom functionality.</p>
<p>Since contact forms are essential for marketing, WPForms is a must have plugin for every website!</p>
<h4>Full WPForms Feature List</h4>
<ul>
<li><a href="https://wpforms.com/features/drag-drop-online-form-builder/?utm_source=wprepo&amp;utm_medium=link&amp;utm_campaign=liteplugin" rel="friend nofollow ugc">Online Form Builder</a> &#8211; Our powerful drag &amp; drop contact form builder allows you to easily create WordPress contact forms and other online forms in just a few minutes without writing any code.</li>
<li>100% Responsive &#8211; Mobile Friendly contact forms.</li>
<li>GDPR Friendly &#8211; Make your contact form GDPR compatible with just a few clicks.</li>
<li><a href="https://wpforms.com/features/form-templates/?utm_source=wprepo&amp;utm_medium=link&amp;utm_campaign=liteplugin" rel="friend nofollow ugc">Form Templates</a> &#8211; Use our pre-built form templates to save time. Never start from scratch again (see all <a href="https://wpforms.com/demo/?utm_source=wprepo&amp;utm_medium=link&amp;utm_campaign=liteplugin" rel="friend nofollow ugc">form templates demos</a>).</li>
<li><a href="https://wpforms.com/features/spam-protection/?utm_source=wprepo&amp;utm_medium=link&amp;utm_campaign=liteplugin" rel="friend nofollow ugc">Spam Protection</a> &#8211; WPForms provides smart anti-spam protection out-of-the-box, plus direct integrations with hCaptcha and Google reCAPTCHA.</li>
<li><a href="https://wpforms.com/features/instant-notifications/?utm_source=wprepo&amp;utm_medium=link&amp;utm_campaign=liteplugin" rel="friend nofollow ugc">Instant Form Notification</a> &#8211; Quickly respond to incoming inquiries with our instant contact form notification system.</li>
<li><a href="https://wpforms.com/features/form-confirmation/?utm_source=wprepo&amp;utm_medium=link&amp;utm_campaign=liteplugin" rel="friend nofollow ugc">Smart Form Confirmation</a> &#8211; Show a custom success message, or redirect users to a custom thank you page.</li>
<li><a href="https://wpforms.com/features/file-uploads/?utm_source=wprepo&amp;utm_medium=link&amp;utm_campaign=liteplugin" rel="friend nofollow ugc">File Uploads</a> &#8211; Collect files and media through your contact forms with File Uploads.</li>
<li><a href="https://wpforms.com/features/multi-page-forms/?utm_source=wprepo&amp;utm_medium=link&amp;utm_campaign=liteplugin" rel="friend nofollow ugc">Multi-Page Forms</a> &#8211; Split long forms into multiple pages with progress bar to improve user experience.</li>
<li><a href="https://wpforms.com/features/conditional-logic/?utm_source=wprepo&amp;utm_medium=link&amp;utm_campaign=liteplugin" rel="friend nofollow ugc">Smart Conditional Logic</a> &#8211; Show or hide fields and contact form sections based on user behavior.</li>
<li><a href="https://wpforms.com/addons/signature-addon/?utm_source=wprepo&amp;utm_medium=link&amp;utm_campaign=liteplugin" rel="friend nofollow ugc">Signature Forms</a> &#8211; Create signature forms or add the signature field to your contact form, application form, booking form, etc.</li>
<li><a href="https://wpforms.com/addons/user-registration-addon/?utm_source=wprepo&amp;utm_medium=link&amp;utm_campaign=liteplugin" rel="friend nofollow ugc">User Registration Forms</a> &#8211; Create custom user registration form and custom login form in WordPress.</li>
<li><a href="https://wpforms.com/addons/post-submissions-addon/?utm_source=wprepo&amp;utm_medium=link&amp;utm_campaign=liteplugin" rel="friend nofollow ugc">Post Submissions</a> &#8211; Collect user-submitted content in WordPress with our front-end post submission form. Great for guest posts, testimonials, business directory, listings, etc.</li>
<li><a href="https://wpforms.com/addons/geolocation-addon/?utm_source=wprepo&amp;utm_medium=link&amp;utm_campaign=liteplugin" rel="friend nofollow ugc">Geolocation</a> &#8211; Display location information about your users.</li>
<li><a href="https://wpforms.com/addons/custom-catpcha-addon/?utm_source=wprepo&amp;utm_medium=link&amp;utm_campaign=liteplugin" rel="friend nofollow ugc">Custom Captchas</a> &#8211; Create custom captchas for your contact form.</li>
<li><a href="https://wpforms.com/addons/surveys-and-polls-addon/?utm_source=wprepo&amp;utm_medium=link&amp;utm_campaign=liteplugin" rel="friend nofollow ugc">Surveys and Polls</a> &#8211; Easily create surveys forms and analyze the data with interactive reports.</li>
<li><a href="https://wpforms.com/addons/form-abandonment-addon/?utm_source=wprepo&amp;utm_medium=link&amp;utm_campaign=liteplugin" rel="friend nofollow ugc">Form Abandonment</a> &#8211; Unlock more leads and grow your business with partial-form submission.</li>
<li><a href="https://wpforms.com/addons/form-locker-addon/?utm_source=wprepo&amp;utm_medium=link&amp;utm_campaign=liteplugin" rel="friend nofollow ugc">Form Locker</a> &#8211; Manage form permissions and add access control rules including password-protected forms, members only forms, limit contact form entry per person, close form after specific date / time, etc.</li>
<li><a href="https://wpforms.com/addons/offline-forms-addon/?utm_source=wprepo&amp;utm_medium=link&amp;utm_campaign=liteplugin" rel="friend nofollow ugc">Offline Forms</a> &#8211; Let your visitors save their entered data offline and submit when their internet connection is restored.</li>
<li><a href="https://wpforms.com/addons/form-pages-addon/?utm_source=wprepo&amp;utm_medium=link&amp;utm_campaign=liteplugin" rel="friend nofollow ugc">Form Landing Pages</a> &#8211; Create &#8220;distraction-free&#8221; form landing pages to boost conversions. Great Google Forms and Wufoo alternative.</li>
<li><a href="https://wpforms.com/addons/conversational-forms-addon/?utm_source=wprepo&amp;utm_medium=link&amp;utm_campaign=liteplugin" rel="friend nofollow ugc">Conversational Forms</a> &#8211; Interactive form layout that makes your form feels more human and boost overall completion rate. Great for surveys and registration forms. Perfect Typeform alternative for WordPress without the high costs.</li>
<li><a href="https://wpforms.com/addons/webhooks-addon/?utm_source=wprepo&amp;utm_medium=link&amp;utm_campaign=liteplugin" rel="friend nofollow ugc">Webhooks</a> &#8211; Send form entry data to secondary tools and external services. No code required, and no need for a third party connector.</li>
<li><a href="https://wpforms.com/addons/user-journey-addon/?utm_source=wprepo&amp;utm_medium=link&amp;utm_campaign=liteplugin" rel="friend nofollow ugc">User Journey Reporting</a> &#8211; Discover the steps your visitors take before they submit your forms. Right in the WordPress dashboard, you can easily see the content that’s driving the most valuable form conversions.</li>
</ul>

Route your contact form data to your favorite CRM, email marketing service, etc.</li>
</ul>
<p>After reading this feature list, you can probably imagine why WPForms is the best WordPress contact form plugin in the market.</p>

";s:12:"installation";s:738:"<ol>
<li>Install WPForms Lite either via the WordPress.org plugin repository or by uploading the files to your server. (See instructions on <a href="http://www.wpbeginner.com/beginners-guide/step-by-step-guide-to-install-a-wordpress-plugin-for-beginners/" rel="friend nofollow ugc">how to install a WordPress plugin</a>)</li>
<li>Activate WPForms Lite.</li>
<li>Navigate to the WPForms tab at the bottom of your admin menu and click the &#8220;Add New&#8221; button to begin creating your new WordPress contact form.</li>
<li>Want more features? <a href="https://wpforms.com/?utm_source=wprepo&amp;utm_medium=link&amp;utm_campaign=liteplugin" title="WPForms" rel="friend nofollow ugc">Purchase the full version of WPForms</a>!</li>
</ol>

<dt id='who%20should%20use%20wpforms%3F'>
Who should use WPForms?
</h4>
<p>
<p>WPForms is perfect for business owners, bloggers, designers, developers, photographers, and basically everyone else. If you want to create a custom WordPress form, then you need to use the WPForms drag &amp; drop form builder.</p>
</p>
<dt id='do%20i%20need%20to%20have%20coding%20skills%20to%20use%20wpforms%3F'>
Do I need to have coding skills to use WPForms?
</h4>
<p>
<p>Absolutely not. You can create and manage forms without any coding knowledge (100% drag &amp; drop form builder). WPForms is the most beginner friendly contact form plugin in the market.</p>
</p>
<dt id='what%20type%20of%20wordpress%20forms%20can%20i%20build%20with%20wpforms%3F'>
What type of WordPress forms can I build with WPForms?
</h4>
<p>
<p>WPForms drag &amp; drop form builder combined with our addons is the most powerful WordPress contact form plugin in the market. Here are some types of WordPress forms you can create:</p>
<ul>
<li>Simple Contact Forms</li>
<li>Job Application Contact Form</li>
<li>Feedback Survey Contact Form</li>
<li>Make a Suggestion Contact Form</li>
<li>Change Request Forms</li>
<li>Online Booking Forms</li>
<li>Event Booking Form</li>
<li>Video Release Forms</li>
<li>PTO Request Contact Form</li>
<li>Maintenance Request Contact Form</li>
<li>Scholarship Application Forms</li>
<li>File Download Forms</li>
<li>Employment Verification Forms</li>
<li>Make a Referral Contact Form</li>
<li>Volunteer Registration Contact Form</li>
<li>Offline Contact Form</li>
</ul>
<p>To see a full list, visit our <a href="https://wpforms.com/demo/?utm_source=wprepo&amp;utm_medium=link&amp;utm_campaign=liteplugin" rel="friend nofollow ugc">Form Template Gallery</a> which has over 150+ pre-made contact form templates.</p>
</p>
<dt id='which%20form%20fields%20does%20wpforms%20offer%3F'>
Which Form Fields Does WPForms offer?
</h4>
<p>
<p>We made WPForms form builder to be both easy and powerful.</p>
<p>Here are the contact form fields that comes with WPForms Form Builder (also known as Standard Fields):</p>
<ul>
<li>Text Field</li>
<li>Paragraph Text (Textarea)</li>
<li>Dropdown Field</li>
<li>Multiple Choice (Radio Buttons)</li>
<li>Checkboxes</li>
<li>Numbers Field</li>
<li>Name Field</li>
<li>Email Address Field</li>
<li>Number Slider Field</li>
</ul>
<p>Here is a list of our advanced contact form builder fields (Fancy Fields):</p>
<ul>
<li>Website / URL Field</li>
<li>Address Field</li>
<li>Password Field</li>
<li>Smart Phone Field with international format verification</li>
<li>Date / Time Field</li>
<li>Hidden Field</li>
<li>HTML Field &#8211; add Custom HTML inside your form</li>
<li>File Upload &#8211; Great for File Upload Form</li>
<li>Page Break Field &#8211; Great for Multi Page Contact Form with Progress Bar.</li>
<li>Section Divider &#8211; Great for Long Contact Forms</li>
<li>Signature Field &#8211; Great for Contracts and Booking Forms</li>
<li>Star Rating &#8211; Great for Survey Forms and Polls</li>
<li>Likert Scale &#8211; Great for Survey Forms</li>
<li>Net Promoter Score (NPS Field) &#8211; Great for Survey Forms</li>
<li>Questions CAPTCHA &#8211; Great for Preventing Contact Form Spam</li>
<li>Math CAPTCHA &#8211; Great for Preventing Contact Form Spam</li>
<li>Google ReCAPTCHA &#8211; Great for Preventing Contact Form Spam</li>
</ul>
<p>Here is a list of our Payment Fields that will help you create a order form, donation form, booking form, and other payment forms:</p>
<ul>
<li>Single Item</li>
<li>Multiple Items</li>
<li>Checkbox Items</li>
<li>Dropdown Items</li>
<li>Total (Calculation Field)</li>
<li>Credit Card (Stripe and Authorize.Net)</li>
<li>PayPal</li>
</ul>
</p>
<dt id='can%20i%20integrate%20wpforms%20with%20my%20crm%20or%20email%20marketing%20service%3F'>
Can I integrate WPForms with my CRM or Email Marketing Service?
</h4>
<p>
<p>Yes, WPForms offers seamless integration with over 1,000+ popular <a href="https://www.wpbeginner.com/showcase/best-email-marketing-services/" rel="nofollow ugc">email marketing</a> and <a href="https://www.wpbeginner.com/showcase/best-crm-software-for-small-businesses-compared/" rel="nofollow ugc">CRM software</a>.</p>
<p>You can easily send data from your contact form and other WordPress forms to your favorite CRM, email newsletter, and other marketing platforms.</p>
<p>Here is a list of our popular marketing integrations:</p>
<ul>
<li>Mailchimp</li>
<li>Constant Contact</li>
<li>AWeber</li>
<li>Drip</li>
<li>Campaign Monitor</li>
<li>GetResponse</li>
<li>ActiveCampaign</li>
<li>Zapier</li>
<li>Salsesforce CRM</li>
<li>Sendinblue</li>
</ul>
<p>Using our Zapier integration, you can easily connect WPForms with over 1000+ marketing apps including:</p>
<ul>
<li>PipeDrive CRM</li>
<li>HubSpot Email Marketing</li>
<li>HubSpot CRM</li>
<li>Google Sheets</li>
<li>Active Campaign</li>
<li>Zoho CRM</li>
<li>Zoho Mail</li>
<li>Zoho Invoice</li>
<li>Agile CRM</li>
<li>Slack</li>
<li>Trello</li>
<li>Infusionsoft by Keap</li>
<li>Microsoft Excel</li>
<li>Dropbox</li>
<li>HelpScout</li>
<li>Zendesk</li>
<li>Freshbooks</li>
<li>Freshsales</li>
<li>Intercom</li>
<li>Click Funnels</li>
<li>Microsoft Dynamics 365 CRM</li>
<li>Capsule CRM</li>
<li>Insightly CRM</li>
<li>Printfection</li>
<li>Acuity Scheduling</li>
<li>Quickbooks Online</li>
</ul>
<p>See all <a href="https://zapier.com/apps/wpforms/integrations" rel="nofollow ugc">WPForms Zapier Integrations</a>.</p>
<p>Note: WPForms was voted Zapier&#8217;s 8th fastest growing app in the world.</p>
</p>
<dt id='can%20i%20create%20a%20payment%20form%20with%20wpforms'>
Can I create a Payment Form with WPForms
</h4>
<p>
<p>Yes, WPForms is not your average contact form plugin. You can use it to create any type of form including payment forms.</p>
<p>We make it easy for you to accept payments using Stripe, Authorize.Net, and PayPal.</p>
<p>Both our Stripe and Authorize.Net integrations helps you easily accept credit card payments online.</p>
<p>Our PayPal integration allows you to accept PayPal payments online.</p>
</p>
<dt id='can%20i%20import%20%2F%20export%20forms%20with%20wpforms%3F'>
Can I Import / Export Forms with WPForms?
</h4>
<p>
<p>Yes, WPForms makes it easy to import / export your contact forms and other WordPress forms created with WPForms form builder. This is incredibly useful for developers and agencies who are building websites for clients.</p>
<p>You can also create custom form templates that you can use on client websites. For more see our documentation.</p>
<p>Aside from that, WPForms also allows you to import froms from other WordPress Contact Form plugins such as Contact Form 7, Ninja Forms, and Pirate Forms.</p>
<p>If you&#8217;re not happy with your WordPress contact form plugin, then definitely give WPForms a try!</p>
</p>
<dt id='i%27d%20like%20access%20to%20all%20features.%20how%20can%20i%20get%20them%3F'>
I&#8217;d like access to all features. How can I get them?
</h4>
<p>
<p>You can get access to more features, addons and support by <a href="https://wpforms.com/?utm_source=wprepo&amp;utm_medium=link&amp;utm_campaign=liteplugin" title="Click here to learn more about WPForms!" rel="friend nofollow ugc">upgrading to our Pro version</a>. Purchasing a Pro license gets you access to the full version of WPForms, automatic updates, priority support, and all WPForms Addons!</p>
</p>
<dt id='is%20wpforms%20translation%20ready%3F'>
Is WPForms translation ready?
</h4>
<p>
<p>Yes, WPForms has full translation and localization support via the wpforms textdomain. All .mo and .po translation files should go into the languages folder in the base of the plugin. The same is true for every WPForms Addon as well.</p>
</p>
<dt id='does%20wpforms%20include%20spam%20protection%3F'>
Does WPForms include spam protection?
</h4>
<p>
<p>Yes, WPForms includes spam proection which is enabled on all forms by default in the form settings.</p>
<p>Additionally, Google reCAPTCHA is also supported and can be setup at WPForms &gt; Settings &gt; reCAPTCHA.</p>
<p>WPForms is fully compatible with all versions of Google reCAPTCHA:</p>
<ul>
<li>Checkbox reCAPTCHA v2</li>
<li>Invisible reCAPTCHA v2</li>
<li>reCAPTCHA v3</li>
</ul>
<p>Lastly, <a href="https://wpforms.com/addons/custom-catpcha-addon/?utm_source=wprepo&amp;utm_medium=link&amp;utm_campaign=liteplugin" rel="friend nofollow ugc">Custom Captchas</a> are available which allow you to create math or question based captchas for your contact forms.</p>
</p>

";s:9:"changelog";s:12816:"<h4>1.6.6</h4>
<ul>
<li>Added: WordPress 5.7 new color scheme compatibility.</li>
<li>Changed: Allow using 0/false values in choices label for Checkboxes, Multiple Choice, Dropdown fields.</li>
<li>Changed: Better AJAX form submit error messages handling for the Email field.</li>
<li>Changed: Refactored Tools page with all of its subpages for easier long-term support.</li>
<li>Changed: Updated the WPForms &gt; About Us page.</li>
<li>Changed: Updated DOMPurify lib to 2.2.7.</li>
<li>Changed: Replaced jQuery.ready() function usage with a recommended way since jQuery 3.0.</li>
<li>Fixed: HTML layout is broken on the Analytics page for some site languages.</li>
<li>Fixed: Incorrect permission checks for different places in the dashboard and the Form Builder.</li>
<li>Fixed: RTL support for Name, Email fields.</li>
<li>Fixed: Speed up the Form Builder rendering by loading certain scripts only when the Embed functionality is triggered.</li>
<li>Fixed: The <code>iframe</code> HTML element was not rendered incorrectly in the Twenty Twenty theme.</li>
<li>Fixed: The Checkboxes and Multiple Choice fields CSS issues in Twenty Twenty-One theme.</li>
<li>Fixed: WPForms Challenge was drunk in the Firefox browser.</li>
<li>Fixed: reCAPTCHA doesn&#8217;t render in a popup when the same form exists in another place.</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.6.5</h4>
<ul>
<li>Changed: Updated DOMPurify lib to 2.2.6.</li>
<li>Changed: Reload the Form Builder after Save and Embed option usage, and going back using the browser Back button.</li>
<li>Changed: Disable From Name and From Email fields in Form Builder &gt; Notifications when the WP Mail SMTP plugin forces those values.</li>
<li>Fixed: The Gutenberg block JavaScript issue in WordPress 5.0-5.1.1 versions.</li>
<li>Fixed: The Gutenberg block CSS issues in Twenty Twenty-One theme.</li>
<li>Fixed: AMP incompatible script for Lite version.</li>
<li>Fixed: Logs records on WPForms &gt; Tools &gt; Logs may not be clickable under certain circumstances, preventing previewing the logged information.</li>
<li>Fixed: Email Summaries ignoring timezone offset while generating reports.</li>
<li>Fixed: Email Suggestion feature when using two or more forms on a page.</li>
<li>Fixed: Missing on-hover tooltips&#8217; after cloning/duplicating elements in the Form Builder.</li>
<li>Fixed: Minor styling issues on the WPForms &gt; Tools &gt; Logs page.</li>
<li>Fixed: Issues while importing forms saved in UTF-8 with BOM.</li>
<li>Fixed: Improve performance of the WPForms Challenge.</li>
<li>Fixed: WPForms module icon compatibility with the latest Elementor version.</li>
<li>Fixed: Incorrect CPT and taxonomy terms alphabetical sorting of the Dynamic Choice option values for fields that support this Advanced Option.</li>
<li>Fixed: Compatibility with WordPress 4.9 on the WPForms &gt; Analytics/SMTP pages.</li>
<li>Fixed: AJAX form submissions on some server configuration.</li>
<li>Fixed: Improve Admin Menu Bar support since WordPress 5.2.</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.6.4.1</h4>
<ul>
<li>Added: Frontend form warning indicating missing WPForms JS (visible to admin only).</li>
<li>Changed: Help hCaptcha process all requests in a more efficient way, so bot detection will work better.</li>
<li>Fixed: Improve pagination on Tools &gt; Logs page inside the plugin admin area.</li>
<li>Fixed: Various JavaScript issues on create post/page/form pages in WordPress 5.6.</li>
<li>Fixed: Edge cases when custom fields mapping for providers was broken.</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.6.4</h4>
<ul>
<li>Added: hCaptcha support, see WPForms &gt; CAPTCHA settings.</li>
<li>Added: Character/word limit validation message control inside Settings &gt; Validation page.</li>
<li>Changed: Dropdown fields using the Modern format will only show the search option if at least 8 choices are provided.</li>
<li>Changed: Updated jQuery inputmask library to v5.0.6-beta20</li>
<li>Changed: Improved Form Builder Help documentation caching.</li>
<li>Changed: Only create our Logs database table when specifically enabled in the Tools settings.</li>
<li>Changed: Updated WPForms install count and rating information.</li>
<li>Changed: Added &#8220;Copy to Clipboard&#8221; button inside Form Embed modal.</li>
<li>Fixed: PHP Warning caused by Email field changes.</li>
<li>Fixed: Editing multiline text in Paragraph field breaks new lines in submitted text.</li>
<li>Fixed: Javascript conflicts with IE11.</li>
<li>Fixed: Possible errors if web host had <code>set_time_limit()</code> disabled.</li>
<li>Fixed: Email validation issue if form is in a page multiple times.</li>
<li>Fixed: Footer links in the Summary email are now working properly.</li>
<li>Fixed: Double-click issue for &#8220;Add New Account&#8221; buttons on the Settings &gt; Integrations page.</li>
<li>Fixed: Gutenberg block ignores &#8220;Include Form Styling&#8221; setting and forces full CSS stylesheet.</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.6.3.1</h4>
<ul>
<li>Added: Native integration with Divi.</li>
<li>Added: Email field Allowlist/Denylist restrictions, see Email field Advanced Options.</li>
<li>Added: Form builder Help &#8211; contextual help, search docs, and more.</li>
<li>Added: Logging, which can be enabled for troubleshooting from WPForms &gt; Tools &gt; Logs.</li>
<li>Changed: Nicely notify users in the Form Builder when their WordPress session has expired, and they can&#8217;t save the form anymore without a page reload.</li>
<li>Changed: Better AJAX form submit field error messages handling.</li>
<li>Fixed: Custom metabox heading styling due to WordPress core changes.</li>
<li>Fixed: Page title smart tag not working in some use cases when using AJAX form submissions.</li>
<li>Fixed: Various admin area display issues when the field label is empty.</li>
<li>Fixed: Logo Translate plugin integration issues.</li>
<li>Fixed: Elementor widget edge case issues.</li>
<li>Fixed: Form settings could be visible before the form was created.</li>
<li>Fixed: Form builder styling inconsistencies with Dropdown field styles.</li>
<li>Fixed: Input mask issues with some mobile browsers, notably Chrome.</li>
<li>Fixed: Always display the WPForms admin area in the user&#8217;s language regardless of the site language.</li>
<li>Fixed: Do not load certain JS variables twice on the front end.</li>
<li>Fixed: Form title display issue inside the form builder with smaller view ports.</li>
<li>Fixed: Elementor widget display issue on frontend when no form has been created.</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.6.2.3</h4>
<ul>
<li>Changed: Added shortcode access to a form embed modal and enhanced modal navigation.</li>
<li>Changed: Improved empty states for All Forms and Builder no fields preview panel.</li>
<li>Changed: Improved Email Summaries footer text.</li>
<li>Fixed: Custom validation messages for the fields appear correctly with Ajax form submission enabled.</li>
<li>Fixed: Base style CSS introduces no additional scrollbars now.</li>
<li>Fixed: Correct cursor for image choices validation messages.</li>
<li>Fixed: Getting the license details from DB works as expected regardless of a context.</li>
<li>Fixed: Getting the list of WPForms addons for user license level works as expected regardless of a context.</li>
<li>Fixed: Number Slider field increment is checked to be more than zero.</li>
<li>Fixed: Modern Dropdown validation works as expected for AJAX forms.</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.6.2.2</h4>
<ul>
<li>Added: Caching friendly anti-spam protection (form tokens).</li>
<li>Added: Native integration with Elementor: add to the page and create new forms right inside its builder.</li>
<li>Added: Add a preview to the WPForms Gutenberg block.</li>
<li>Changed: Greatly improve WPForms Challenge experience.</li>
<li>Changed: Improve word counting when the Limit Length field option is used with Single Line Text/Paragraph Text fields.</li>
<li>Changed: Improve Number field input restrictions with various browsers.</li>
<li>Changed: Form field validation will now fail if input mask is enabled and user input does not complete required input mask elements.</li>
<li>Changed: Icon for the Multiple Choice field is now more representative.</li>
<li>Changed: Hide Delete button for a &#8220;Default Notification&#8221; in the Form Builder.</li>
<li>Changed: Improve Lite migrations for WordPress Multisite installations.</li>
<li>Changed: Update Constant Contact logos because of their rebranding.</li>
<li>Changed: Improve descriptions of various plugin options and add more context to them.</li>
<li>Fixed: Properly map fields in various addons when the first field is added in the Form Builder.</li>
<li>Fixed: Issue when editing Checkbox field entry values when dynamic choices were enabled and multiple values were saved.</li>
<li>Fixed: Refresh the list of form fields that are required to properly render marketing addons.</li>
<li>Fixed: &#8220;Invalid Form&#8221; error for logged out users upon submitting an AJAX form on some server configurations.</li>
<li>Fixed: Multiple Choice fields had issues in the builder with image choices with empty labels.</li>
<li>Fixed: Make bulk actions at the bottom of the Forms Overview work.</li>
<li>Fixed: &#8220;Single Line Text&#8221; and &#8220;Paragraph Text&#8221; calculate empty field word count incorrectly.</li>
<li>Fixed: Do not allow Action Scheduler to generate errors during the plugin uninstallation procedure.</li>
<li>Fixed: Input mask validation produces a JS error on jQuery 3.x.</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.6.1</h4>
<ul>
<li>Added: Display a list of scheduled actions on WPForms &gt; Tools &gt; Scheduled Actions page.</li>
<li>Added: Multiple select option for Dropdown field (off by default).</li>
<li>Added: New Modern style option for Dropdown field (off by default).</li>
<li>Added: Support Smart Tags in form descriptions.</li>
<li>Fixed: Properly handle multiple clicks on various accordion-like elements on Form Builder and Settings &gt; Integrations pages.</li>
<li>Fixed: Remove all the plugin-related information on uninstall from the DB when opted-in in plugin settings.</li>
<li>Fixed: Replace all new lines characters with spaces in notification email subjects (e.g., when an address field value is used in a subject via a smart tag).</li>
<li>Fixed: Make sure the plugin doesn&#8217;t crash when <code>iconv</code> PHP extension is not installed on a server.</li>
<li>Fixed: Properly handle fields with choices with new lines in their labels when connected to Conditional Logic.</li>
<li>Fixed: Google Invisible v2 reCAPTCHA should show Submit Button Processing Text when the form is submitted.</li>
<li>Fixed: Display the list of countries in the &#8220;Countries&#8221; preset and in the Address field in alphabetical order regardless of the current site language.</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.6.0.2</h4>
<ul>
<li>Fixed: The default value 0 (zero) of the Paragraph Text field does not display on the frontend.</li>
<li>Fixed: Product education URL encoding issues.</li>
<li>Fixed: Securely store WPForms anonymized cookie, so it cannot be sent along with cross-site requests (samesite).</li>
<li>Fixed: Various PHP notices that may appear during wildly complicated forms submissions.</li>
<li>Fixed: Improved escaping inside Form Builder live preview, props Fortinet Fortiguard Labs.</li>
<li>Fixed: Incorrect interval value was used when running a cleanup job after notifications sent.</li>
<li>Fixed: Delete orphaned plugin translation files when cleanup option in plugin settings is checked and the plugin is deleted from the site.</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.6.0.1</h4>
<ul>
<li>Added: Admin bar menu item.</li>
<li>Added: Form Builder alert when using browser &#8220;Back&#8221; button if form contains unsaved changes.</li>
<li>Added: Settings &gt; Emails: &#8220;Optimize Email Sending&#8221; option which enables sending emails asynchronously.</li>
<li>Changed: Async form notification emails are now off by default.</li>
<li>Changed: Number Slider field display improvements on small devices.</li>
<li>Fixed: Error if there are some plugins or themes add <code>widget_title</code> filter.</li>
<li>Fixed: Choice Images not displaying in form notifications if no label is set.</li>
<li>Fixed: Form Builder &#8220;drag zone&#8221; not available when all fields are deleted.</li>
<li>Fixed: Empty <code>div</code> appended to end of form display.</li>
<li>Fixed: Block alignment issues (WordPress 5.4+).</li>
<li>Fixed: Form Builder field option panel is not available if field is placed before the last form field.</li>
<li>Fixed: Fallback population for fields with choices (checkbox, radio etc) when special characters are used.</li>
<li>Fixed: Integrity of decoded data with additional sanitizing.</li>
<li>Fixed: Compatibility issues with Elementor.</li>
</ul>
<p><a href="https://plugins.svn.wordpress.org/wpforms-lite/trunk/changelog.txt" rel="nofollow ugc">See changelog for all versions</a>.</p>

Events Calendar";s:4:"slug";s:19:"the-events-calendar";s:7:"version";s:7:"5.5.0.1";s:6:"author";s:52:"<a href="https://evnt.is/1x">The Events Calendar</a>";s:14:"author_profile";s:48:"https://profiles.wordpress.org/theeventscalendar";s:8:"requires";s:6:"4.9.14";s:6:"tested";s:5:"5.7.0";s:12:"requires_php";s:3:"5.6";s:6:"rating";i:88;s:7:"ratings";a:5:{i:5;i:1420;i:4;i:106;i:3;i:64;i:2;i:49;i:1;i:189;}s:11:"num_ratings";i:1828;s:15:"support_threads";i:204;s:24:"support_threads_resolved";i:28;s:10:"downloaded";i:28197301;s:12:"last_updated";s:21:"2021-04-05 6:11pm GMT";s:5:"added";s:10:"2010-01-19";s:8:"homepage";s:0:"";s:8:"sections";a:5:{s:11:"description";s:6643:"<p>Easily create and manage an events calendar on your WordPress site with <a href="https://evnt.is/mj" rel="nofollow ugc">The Events Calendar</a> free plugin. Whether your events are in-person or virtual events, this WordPress calendar plugin boasts professional features backed by our world-class team of developers and designers.</p>
<p><div class="embed-vimeo" style="text-align: center;"><iframe loading="lazy" src="https://player.vimeo.com/video/425323974" width="640" height="360" frameborder="0" webkitallowfullscreen mozallowfullscreen allowfullscreen></iframe></div>
</p>
<p>Packed with loads of features, The Events Calendar is ready to go out of the box. It’s also extensible, easy to use, and completely customizable.</p>
<h4>📅 The #1 Calendar for WordPress</h4>
<p>See the calendar in action on our <a href="https://evnt.is/1ajs" rel="nofollow ugc">demo experience</a>. Just getting started? Read through the <a href="https://evnt.is/2d" rel="nofollow ugc">New User Primer</a> to get set up.</p>
<p>Looking for additional features like recurring events, ticket sales, user-submitted events, automatic imports, and more?</p>
<p><strong>Check out <a href="https://evnt.is/mj" rel="nofollow ugc">Events Calendar Pro</a>, <a href="https://evnt.is/197u" rel="nofollow ugc">Event Aggregator</a>, and <a href="https://evnt.is/2a" rel="nofollow ugc">more add-ons</a>.</strong></p>
<h4>🔌🎨 Plug and Play or Customize</h4>
<p>The Events Calendar is built to work out of the box. Simply install the plugin, configure your settings, and start creating events in minutes.</p>
<p>Want to add your personal touch? Use The Events Calendar as the foundation for customization. Personalize to your heart&#8217;s content with the help of a skeleton stylesheet, partial template overrides, template tags, hooks and filters, <a href="https://evnt.is/eu" rel="nofollow ugc">careful documentation</a>, and a <a href="https://evnt.is/1a0r" rel="nofollow ugc">library of free extensions</a>.</p>
<p>Whether your vision is big or small, you&#8217;re in good company. Hundreds of thousands of small businesses, musicians, venues, restaurants, and non-profits are publishing and promoting their in-person and virtual events with The Events Calendar. Our plugins have also been scaled to work on large networks for Fortune 100 companies, universities, and government institutions.</p>
<h4>✨ Features</h4>
<p>Our feature-rich plugin comes with everything you need to create and manage your calendar.</p>
<p>✔️ Rapidly create events<br />
✔️ Saved venues &amp; organizers<br />
✔️ Calendar month view with tooltips<br />
✔️ Event List view<br />
✔️ Day view<br />
✔️ Block Editor support<br />
✔️ Event search<br />
✔️ Google maps<br />
✔️ Widget: Upcoming events list<br />
✔️ Events Taxonomies (Categories &amp; Tags)<br />
✔️ Google Calendar and iCal exporting<br />
✔️ WP REST API endpoints<br />
✔️ Completely ajaxified for super smooth browsing<br />
✔️ Completely responsive from mobile to tablet to desktop<br />
✔️ Tested on the major theme frameworks such as Avada, Divi, Enfold, Genesis, and many more.<br />
✔️ Increase your SEO with JSON-LD Structured Data<br />
✔️ Internationalized &amp; translated<br />
✔️ Multiple stylesheets to improve integration<br />
✔️ Extensive template tags for customization<br />
✔️ Hooks &amp; filters galore<br />
✔️ Caching support<br />
✔️ Debug mode for developers<br />
✔️ <a href="https://evnt.is/1a0r" rel="nofollow ugc">Library of extensions</a></p>
<h3>📃 Documentation</h3>
<p>All of our documentation can be found in <a href="https://evnt.is/eu" rel="nofollow ugc">our Knowledgebase</a>.</p>

</ul>

<p>Take your calendar to the next level by pairing it with our plugins for ticketing, crowdsourcing, email marketing, and more. Learn more about all our products on <a href="https://evnt.is/18wn" rel="nofollow ugc">our website</a>.</p>
<p>Our Free Plugins:</p>

<h3>Help</h3>
<p>If you aren’t familiar with The Events Calendar, check out our <a href="https://evnt.is/2p" rel="nofollow ugc">New User Primer</a>. It will have you creating events in no time.</p>
<p>Ready to dig deeper? Check out these resources:</p>
<ul>
<li><a href="https://evnt.is/2u" rel="nofollow ugc">Tutorials</a></li>
<li><a href="https://theeventscalendar.com/release-schedule/" rel="nofollow ugc">Release Schedule</a></li>

</ul>
<p>We check in on the <a href="https://wordpress.org/support/plugin/the-events-calendar/">The Events Calendar forum here on WordPress.org</a> about once a week to help users with basic troubleshooting and identifying bugs. If you’re looking for premium, personalized support, consider upgrading to Events Calendar Pro.</p>
<p>Still have a question? Shoot us an email at support@theeventscalendar.com.</p>
";s:12:"installation";s:1322:"<p>Installing the plugin is easy. Just follow one of the following methods:</p>
<h4>Install The Events Calendar from within WordPress</h4>
<ol>
<li>Visit the plugins page within your dashboard and select ‘Add New’</li>
<li>Search for &#8220;Events Calendar&#8221;</li>
<li>Activate The Events Calendar from your Plugins page</li>
<li>You&#8217;re done!</li>
</ol>
<h4>Install The Events Calendar Manually</h4>
<ol>
<li>From the dashboard of your site, navigate to Plugins &#8211;&gt; Add New.</li>
<li>Select the Upload option and hit &#8220;Choose File.&#8221;</li>
<li>When the popup appears select the the-events-calendar-x.x.zip file from your desktop. (The &#8216;x.x&#8217; will change depending on the current version number).</li>
<li>Follow the on-screen instructions and wait as the upload completes.</li>
<li>When it&#8217;s finished, activate the plugin via the prompt. A message will show confirming activation was successful. A link to access the calendar directly on the frontend will be presented here as well.</li>
</ol>
<p>That&#8217;s it! Just configure your settings as you see fit, and you&#8217;re on your way to creating events in style. Need help getting things started? Check out our <a href="https://evnt.is/2l" rel="nofollow ugc">new user primer</a> for help with settings and features.</p>
";s:3:"faq";s:8783:"
<dt id='are%20there%20any%20troubleshooting%20steps%20you%27d%20suggest%20i%20try%20that%20might%20resolve%20my%20issue%20before%20i%20post%20a%20new%20thread%3F'>
Are there any troubleshooting steps you&#8217;d suggest I try that might resolve my issue before I post a new thread?
</h4>
<p>
<p>First, make sure that you&#8217;re running the latest version of The Events Calendar. If you’re running Events Calendar PRO or  any other add-ons, make sure those are current / running the latest code as well.</p>
<p>The most common issues we see are either plugin or theme conflicts. You can test if a plugin or theme is conflicting by manually deactivating other plugins until just The Events Calendar is running on your site. If the issue persists from there, revert to the default <a href="https://wordpress.org/themes/twentytwenty/">Twenty Twenty</a> theme. If the issue is resolved after deactivating a specific plugin or your theme, you’ll know that is the source of the conflict.</p>
<p>Note that we aren’t going to say “tough luck” if you identify a plugin/theme conflict. While we can’t guarantee 100% integration with any plugin or theme out there, we will do our best (and reach out the plugin/theme author as needed) to figure out a solution that benefits everyone.</p>
</p>
<dt id='i%27m%20still%20stuck.%20where%20do%20i%20go%20to%20file%20a%20bug%20or%20ask%20a%20question%3F'>
I&#8217;m still stuck. Where do I go to file a bug or ask a question?
</h4>
<p>
<p>Users of the free The Events Calendar should post their questions in the plugin&#8217;s <a href="https://wordpress.org/support/plugin/the-events-calendar/">WordPress.org forum</a>, which we visit about once a week. Please make sure to read <a href="https://evnt.is/19oc" rel="nofollow ugc">our sticky post</a> providing an overview of the support we provide free users BEFORE posting. If you find you&#8217;re not getting support in as timely a fashion as you wish, you might want to consider purchasing a license for Events Calendar Pro.</p>
<p>If you&#8217;re already an Events Calendar Pro user, you&#8217;re entitled access to our actively-monitored <a href="https://evnt.is/1aju" rel="nofollow ugc">Premium Support</a> on our website. We can provide a deeper level of support here and hit these forums on a daily basis during the work week. Generally, except in times of increased support loads, we reply to all tickets within 24-48 hours during the business week.</p>
</p>
<dt id='what%27s%20the%20difference%20between%20the%20events%20calendar%20and%20events%20calendar%20pro%3F'>
What&#8217;s the difference between The Events Calendar and Events Calendar Pro?
</h4>
<p>
<p>The Events Calendar is our cornerstone plugin, and it’s required in order to run any of our premium calendar add-ons, including Events Calendar Pro, Community Events, Filter Bar, and others.</p>
<p>In other words, Events Calendar Pro runs alongside The Events Calendar and enhances it with extra features, including recurring events, additional calendar views, calendar shortcodes, advanced widgets, custom event fields and more.</p>
</p>
<dt id='what%20add-ons%20are%20available%20for%20the%20events%20calendar%2C%20and%20where%20can%20i%20read%20more%20about%20them%3F'>
What add-ons are available for The Events Calendar, and where can I read more about them?
</h4>
<p>
<p>The following add-ons are available for The Events Calendar:</p>
<ul>
<li><a href="https://evnt.is/18wi" rel="nofollow ugc">Events Calendar Pro</a>, for adding premium calendar features like recurring events, advanced views, cool widgets, <a href="https://evnt.is/1ajw" rel="nofollow ugc">shortcodes</a>, additional fields, and more!</li>
<li><a href="https://evnt.is/197u" rel="nofollow ugc">Event Aggregator</a>, a service that effortlessly fills your calendar with events from Meetup, Google Calendar, iCalendar, Eventbrite, CSV, and ICS.</li>
<li><a href="https://evnt.is/1aky" rel="nofollow ugc">Virtual Events</a>, which optimizes your calendar for virtual events including Zoom integration, video and livestream embeds, SEO optimization for online events and more.</li>
<li><a href="https://wordpress.org/plugins/event-tickets/">Event Tickets</a> (free), which allows you to sell tickets and collect RSVPs to events. It can run alongside The Events Calendar or as a standalone plugin that adds ticket and RSVP functionality to WordPress posts and pages.</li>
<li><a href="https://evnt.is/18wk" rel="nofollow ugc">Event Tickets Plus</a>, which allows you to sell tickets for your events using your favorite e-commerce platform.</li>
<li><a href="https://evnt.is/1ajt" rel="nofollow ugc">Promoter</a>, automated email communication made just for The Events Calendar and Event Tickets. Stay in touch with your attendees every step of the way.</li>
<li><a href="https://evnt.is/2g" rel="nofollow ugc">Community Events</a>, for allowing frontend event submission from your readers.</li>
<li><a href="https://evnt.is/18wl" rel="nofollow ugc">Community Tickets</a>, which allows event organizers to sell tickets to the events they submit via Community Events.</li>
<li><a href="https://evnt.is/fa" rel="nofollow ugc">Filter Bar</a>, for adding advanced frontend filtering capabilities to your events calendar.</li>
<li><a href="https://evnt.is/2e" rel="nofollow ugc">Eventbrite Tickets</a>, for selling tickets to your event directly through Eventbrite.</li>
</ul>
</p>
<dt id='can%20i%20import%20events%20to%20my%20calendar%3F'>
Can I import events to my calendar?
</h4>
<p>
<p>Yes! The Events Calendar has a built-in CSV import tool. If you want to step it up and automatically import events from Google Calendar, Meetup, Eventbrite and more, check out <a href="https://evnt.is/197u" rel="nofollow ugc">Event Aggregator</a>.</p>
</p>
<dt id='how%20do%20i%20sell%20tickets%20to%20events%20on%20my%20calendar%3F'>
How do I sell tickets to events on my calendar?
</h4>
<p>
<p>You&#8217;ll want to use our <a href="https://wordpress.org/plugins/event-tickets/">Event Tickets</a> plugin for that. This free plugin works alongside The Events Calendar and lets you create RSVPs and tickets for events. Event Tickets integrates with PayPal so you can collect payments for tickets, while our premium solution, Event Tickets Plus fully integrates with WooCommerce or Easy Digital Downloads.</p>
</p>
<dt id='can%20i%20have%20more%20than%20one%20calendar%20on%20my%20site%3F'>
Can I have more than one calendar on my site?
</h4>
<p>
<p>Unfortunately, no. However, you can use event categories or tags to create calendar views that only display certain events. For example, you could create a direct link to a calendar view that only shows events categorized as &#8220;Fitness,&#8221; <a href="https://evnt.is/1ajv" rel="nofollow ugc">like this example from our demo site</a>.</p>
<p>With Events Calendar Pro, you can use <a href="https://evnt.is/1ajw" rel="nofollow ugc">shortcodes</a> to embed your calendar on other WordPress pages and posts, then filter that calendar by category.</p>
</p>
<dt id='can%20i%20allow%20people%20to%20submit%20events%20to%20my%20calendar%3F'>
Can I allow people to submit events to my calendar?
</h4>
<p>
<p>This is available with the <a href="https://evnt.is/2g" rel="nofollow ugc">Community Events</a> add-on to facilitate submissions. Install Community Events alongside The Events Calendar and a page will be added to your WordPress site with a form that visitors can use to submit events. As the calendar owner, you have full control over whether event submissions are published immediately or require moderation first.</p>
<p>If you want to let users sell tickets for the events they submit, check out <a href="https://evnt.is/18wl" rel="nofollow ugc">Community Tickets</a>. It runs with The Events Calendar, Community Events, and Event Tickets and empowers visitors to create and sell tickets, splitting the profits with you.</p>
</p>
<dt id='i%20have%20a%20feature%20idea.%20what%27s%20the%20best%20way%20to%20tell%20you%20about%20it%3F'>
I have a feature idea. What&#8217;s the best way to tell you about it?
</h4>
<p>
<p>We&#8217;ve got a <a href="https://tribe.uservoice.com/forums/195723-feature-ideas" rel="nofollow ugc">UserVoice page</a> where we&#8217;re actively watching for feature ideas from the community. Vote up existing feature requests or add your own, and help us shape the future of the products business in a way that best meets the community&#8217;s needs.</p>
</p>
<dt id='i%27ve%20still%20got%20questions.%20where%20can%20i%20find%20answers%3F'>
I&#8217;ve still got questions. Where can I find answers?
</h4>
<p>
<p>Check out our extensive <a href="https://evnt.is/18wm" rel="nofollow ugc">knowledgebase</a> for articles on using, tweaking, and troubleshooting our plugins.</p>
</p>

<ul>
<li>Fix &#8211; Reduce overhead of widget setup on every page load by setting up the widgets only as needed. [TEC-3833]</li>

<h4>[5.5.0] 2021-03-29</h4>
<ul>
<li>Feature &#8211; Add <code>has_event</code> and <code>has_no_events</code> to the Venue and Organizer ORM so we can filter requests for both by whether they have events or not.</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Invert quotes to protect against issue with MySQL in <code>ANSI_QUOTES</code> mode. [TEC-3785]</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; correct display order of sticky, featured, and &#8220;normal&#8221; events on Month View. Adds a class for targeting sticky posts for styling. [TEC-3770]</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Ensure the Events List widget also shows the Time Zone when displaying it is set in the admin. [TEC-3747]</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Saving on Blocks editor without Organizer is working as expected again [TEC-3788]</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Fusion Core/Avada Widget implementation of The Events Calendar will no longer throw warnings on the frontend display. [ECP-538]</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Usage of <code>tribe_get_events()</code> for non-existent posts will no longer throw warnings on the Blocks Editor, impacted Community Events Shortcode usage [BTPLAN-121]</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Added rel=noreferrer to Google Map links. [TEC-3795]</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Include actions before and after the creation of a view for REST API requests. Hooks added were: <code>tribe_events_views_v2_before_make_view_for_rest</code> and <code>tribe_events_views_v2_after_make_view_for_rest</code></li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Allow specific filtering to add other views into the HTML caching for performance using hook <code>tribe_events_views_v2_cached_views</code>.</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Include Legacy views deprecation notice [TEC-4809]</li>

<h4>[5.4.0] 2021-02-24</h4>
<ul>
<li>Version &#8211; The Events Calendar 5.4.0 is only compatible with Events Calendar PRO 5.3.0 and higher</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Compatibility with WordPress 5.7 and jQuery 3.5.X</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Updated views JavaScript manager is now deferred to the end of the request, to make sure all dependencies are loaded.</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Navigation for the Views will no longer use current browser URL as previous url, preventing problems on shortcodes.</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Latest Past view moved to not publicly visible, which was the intended behavior.</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Add compatibility container to widgets &#8211; to allow for a non-body target for compatibility classes.</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Include the <code>tribe_events_views_v2_view_page_reset_ignored_params</code> filter to prevent certain params from interfering with pagination resetting. [FBAR-222]</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Use filterable attributes for the view more link and text. Add customizer styling for the link. [ECP-568]</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Removed <code>tribe_events_views_v2_widget_admin_form_{$field_type}_input</code> from the List Widget admin form in favor of using <code>Tribe__Template::do_entry_point()</code> [ECP-486]</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Moved administration templates for List Widget components to Common. [ECP-486]</li>

<h4>[5.1.0] 2020-04-23</h4>
<ul>
<li>Feature &#8211; Add a &#8220;fast forward&#8221; link to Month and Day views when there are no events to show. [TEC-3400]</li>
<li>Feature &#8211; Add <code>tribe_events_views_v2_use_ff_link</code> and <code>tribe_events_views_v2_{$this-&gt;slug}_use_ff_link</code> filters to allow control of the link. [TEC-3400]</li>
<li>Feature &#8211; Add Recent Past Events Views. [TEC-3385]</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Improved on meta data handling of for Blocks editor.</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Deprecate Select2 3.5.4 in favor of SelectWoo</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Load plugin text domain on the new <code>tribe_load_text_domains</code> action hook, which fires on <code>init</code> instead of on the <code>plugins_loaded</code> hook. [TEC-3406]</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Add a constant <code>TRIBE_CACHE_VIEWS</code> to turn off views HTML caching.</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Theme navigation warning around <code>post_date = '0'</code> no longer happens when using Page template for Updated Views [TEC-3434]</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Selecting other Page templates from Settings &gt; Display now loads the correct template properly, to display events.</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Preventing redirects from updated Views V2 to be too broad and end up catching requests from other Plugins, reported by GravityView team on Gravity Forms bug with imports.</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Prevent PHP errors from happening during bulk activation or deactivation of the plugin [TCMN-53]</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Correct iCal link on month view for months other than the current one [TEC-3267]</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Correct a few incorrect and/or typoed text domains [TEC-3390]</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Ensure we pass search keywords when changing views and in the top-bar nav [TEC-3282]</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Prevent Blocks editor from throwing browser alert when leaving the page without any changes applied to the edited post.</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Several strings have been adjusted for consistency and better translatability [BTRIA-307]</li>
<li>Hook &#8211; Add the <code>tribe_events_blocks_editor_is_on</code> filter; returning a falsy value from this filter will prevent the Blocks Editor to ever be active on Events; else the settings from Events &gt; Settings will apply [TEC-3349]</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Add some filters for better control of link targets, standardize the way we create those links [TEC-3402]</li>
<li>Language &#8211; 4 new strings added, 286 updated, 1 fuzzied, and 2 obsoleted</li>
</ul>
<h4>[5.0.3.1] 2020-03-23</h4>
<ul>
<li>Fix &#8211; Assets class modification to prevent JavaScript and CSS failing to load when <code>SCRIPT_DEBUG=true</code> [TCMN-52]</li>
</ul>
<h4>[5.0.3] 2020-03-23</h4>
<ul>
<li>Feature &#8211; Allow users to set a custom name for new Event Aggregator Imports. [TEC-3286]</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Add back missing JSON-LD to Single Events. [TEC-3262]</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Minify the Freemius svg assets. [TEC-3215]</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Remove &#8220;(beta)&#8221; label from URL source type of import. [TEC-3289]</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Reword the Filter Activation setting&#8217;s labels for better clarity.  [FBAR-79]</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Ensure that any values for <code>liveFilterUpdate</code> that are not <code>automatic</code> or <code>manual</code> get converted. [FBAR-83]</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Breakpoint code compatibility with the latest version of jQuery 3.4.1 [BTRIA-154]</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Remove numbers from listed events in event list widget for Genesis theme. [TEC-2957]</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Customizer accent color affects featured line and text. [TEC-3277]</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Resolve conflict between datepicker holding consistent size when navigating and flexibility on small screen sizes. [TEC-3322]</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Respect EA <code>post_status</code> from settings when an event does not have a defined value. [TEC-3255]</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Save the <code>post_status</code> for a scheduled import when using a different value other than <code>publish</code>. [TEC-3296]</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Update events, venues, and organizers to use dynamic labels. [TEC-3280]</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Resolve an issue in Views v2 that would break URLs when the event single and archive slugs have the same value due to the &#8220;Events URL slug&#8221; and &#8220;Single event URL slug&#8221; settings or due to their translations [TEC-3254]</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Restore correct handling of events RSS feeds; events will show in the RSS feed in ascending start date, starting from the current day and the event publish date will be set to the event start date [TEC-3252]</li>
<li>Hook &#8211; Add filters <code>tribe_events_liveupdate_automatic_label_text</code> and <code>tribe_events_liveupdate_manual_label_text</code> to allow Filter Bar to include itself in those labels. [TEC-3322]</li>
<li>Hook &#8211; Add the <code>tribe_views_v2_events_query_controller_active</code> filter; returning a falsy value from this filter will prevent Views v2 from altering the WordPress query. This filter allows handling situations where Views v2 might interfere with third party plugins (e.g. custom RSS feed implementations) [TEC-3252]</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Added filters: <code>tribe_events_option_convert_live_filters</code>, <code>tribe_events_views_v2_messages_need_events_label_keys</code></li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Removed filters: <code>tribe_events_ical_export_text</code></li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Changed views: <code>v2/components/events-bar/search/keyword</code>, <code>v2/month/calendar-body/day</code></li>
<li>Language &#8211; 11 new strings added, 81 updated, 0 fuzzied, and 6 obsoleted</li>
</ul>
<h4>[5.0.2.1] 2020-02-25</h4>
<ul>
<li>Fix &#8211; Plugin dependency registration with <code>Plugin_Register</code> will not prevent loading of all plugins in list if the last item loaded fails. [TCMN-41]</li>
</ul>
<h4>[5.0.2] 2020-02-19</h4>
<ul>
<li>Version &#8211; The Events Calendar 5.0.2 is only compatible with Filter Bar 4.9.2 and higher</li>
<li>Version &#8211; The Events Calendar 5.0.2 is only compatible with Events Calendar PRO 5.0.2 and higher</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Modify Link Color Customizer option for single event links in description, the venue, the organizer, and the website link in classic editor.  [TEC-3219]</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Move link color option to General tab in Customizer and remove Text tab.  [TEC-3244]</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Freemius Opt-out workflow now present on all occasions [TEC-3171]</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Freemius updated to the latest version 2.3.2 [TEC-3171]</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Remove the &#8220;Default stylesheet &#8211; full&#8221; option from display settings, for the new views. [TEC-3125]</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Change the live refresh option to a radio, adjust conditional checks to accommodate. [TEC-3072]</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Freemius activation URL send via email works as expected [TEC-3218]</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Improve compatibility from Updated Views V2 with Beaver Builder plugins [TEC-3248]</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; More robust handling of <code>hide_from_listings</code> in REST API v2, thanks @maxm123</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Make sure the new Views (v2) will correctly print JSON-LD schema information [TEC-3241]</li>
<li>Language &#8211; 4 new strings added, 248 updated, 1 fuzzied, and 3 obsoleted</li>
</ul>
<h4>[5.0.1] 2020-02-12</h4>

<li>Fix &#8211; Fix an issue where Venue provinces would be incorrectly populated in iCal exports [TEC-3223]</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Deleting events after X feature no longer will delete posts with <code>_EventEndDate</code> meta [TEC-3233]</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Adjust tooltip title styles for Twenty Twenty theme. [TEC-2998]</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Remove find events button and related data when events bar is disabled. [TEC-3074]</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Ensure datepicker always updates view via live refresh. [TEC-3073]</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Adjust customizer labels for sites using the new views [TEC-3066]</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Allow start datetime and end datetime to be the same to hide end datetime in frontend when using block editor. [TEC-3009]</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Move the &#8220;Link Color&#8221; option in the customizer, for the new views. [TEC-3067]</li>

</ul>
<h4>[5.0.0.2] 2020-02-06</h4>
<ul>
<li>Fix &#8211; Datepicker format now properly defaults to the correct value when Display Settings have not been saved. [TEC-3229]</li>

</ul>
<h4>[5.0.0.1] 2020-01-31</h4>
<ul>
<li>Fix &#8211; Events with timezones that differ from the site timezone now display on the correct date. [TEC-3208]</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Multi-day events now display on all days that they are supposed to. [TEC-3212]</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; End of day cutoff is now being observed appropriately when creating the day grid stack. [TEC-3210]</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Fix number of parameters when doing <code>the_post</code> action, for the single event view in the new views. [TEC-3214]</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; 404s on permalinks have been resolved by moving the flush permalink action to a later moment of time on activation after all rules have been declared. [TEC-3211]</li>
</ul>
<h4>[5.0.0] 2020-01-27</h4>
<ul>
<li>Feature &#8211; Created new Month, Day, and List views with all new HTML, CSS, and JavaScript.</li>
<li>Feature &#8211; Add upgrade path for new Month, Day, and List views making it opt-in for any existing users.</li>
<li>Feature &#8211; New templating engine to power the new Views. <a href="https://evnt.is/1aid" rel="nofollow ugc">See More</a></li>
<li>Feature &#8211; Views initialization and instance includes more filters and actions to allow improved extensibility and customization. (See all filters below)</li>
<li>Feature &#8211; Views manager and bootstrapping classes were created to allow more control over where and when views will be initialized. (See filters related to those below)</li>
<li>Feature &#8211; Reduced maintenance burden of customizations by leveraging atomic templates for the new views. (See list of files now available below)</li>
<li>Feature &#8211; CSS uses a Block Element Modifier (BEM) methodology to improve reusability of components. <a href="https://evnt.is/1aib" rel="nofollow ugc">See More</a></li>
<li>Feature &#8211; New Views share one JavaScript Manager, which contains multiple jQuery actions and customization points.</li>
<li>Feature &#8211; View navigation relies on the WP Rest API, improving reliability and caching opportunities.</li>
<li>Feature &#8211; Event permalinks are now more consistent across navigation using <code>WP_Rewrite</code> to map params to their matching URL, which improves SEO.</li>
<li>Feature &#8211; Event data filtering used across all new views: <code>tribe_get_event_before</code>, <code>tribe_get_event</code>, <code>tribe_get_event_after</code>, <code>tribe_events_organizers_fetch_callback</code>, <code>tribe_events_venues_fetch_callback</code></li>
<li>Feature &#8211; Venue data filtering used across all new views: <code>tribe_get_venue_object_before</code>, <code>tribe_get_venue_object</code></li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Custom Before and After HTML on the Events &gt; Settings page will now prefer event view styling over the Theme&#8217;s CSS.</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Lowered the reliance on the global <code>$wp_query</code> to create more consistent output and faster maintenance. <a href="https://evnt.is/1aic" rel="nofollow ugc">See More</a></li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; View overrides for the new views will look within a new folder in your theme to avoid conflicting with old The Events Calendar theme customizations <a href="https://evnt.is/1aia" rel="nofollow ugc">See More</a></li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Switch to a compact date while on day and month view in mobile [136789]</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Remove <code>tribe_events_getLink</code> in favor of <code>tribe_events_get_link</code> which was a deprecated filter since version 4.3</li>
<li>Hooks &#8211; View template include and render filters and actions: <code>tribe_template_before_include</code>, <code>tribe_template_before_include:{$template_path}</code>, <code>tribe_template_after_include</code>, <code>tribe_template_after_include:{$template_path}</code>, <code>tribe_template_html</code>, <code>tribe_template_html:{$template_path}</code></li>
<li>Hooks &#8211; View instance filters and actions: <code>tribe_events_views_v2_view_template</code>, <code>tribe_events_views_v2_{$view_slug}_view_template</code>, <code>tribe_events_views_v2_view_context</code>, <code>tribe_events_views_v2_{$view_slug}_view_context</code>, <code>tribe_events_views_v2_view_repository</code>, <code>tribe_events_views_v2_view_html_classes</code>, <code>tribe_events_views_v2_{$view_slug}_view_html_classes</code>, <code>tribe_events_views_v2_url_query_args</code>, <code>tribe_events_views_v2_view_template_vars</code>, <code>tribe_events_views_v2_view_{$view_slug}_template_vars</code>, <code>tribe_events_views_v2_view_url</code>, <code>tribe_events_views_v2_view_{$view_slug}_url</code>, <code>tribe_events_views_v2_view_prev_url</code>, <code>tribe_events_views_v2_view_{$view_slug}_prev_url</code>, <h4>[4.9.14] 2020-01-15</h4>

<li>Tweak &#8211; Divide the <code>tribe-common.js</code> file to prevent that file from being bloated with external dependencies. [129526]</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Make sure <code>UTC-0</code> is converted back to <code>UTC</code> instead of <code>UTC-01</code> [129240]</li>

<li>Fix &#8211; Moved The Events Calendar specific code from common Context class into The Events Calendar [129241]</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Fixed issue where multiday events were not returning correct end date in block editor [128033]</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Resolved issue where deactivation feedback was not hooked properly [128341]</li>

<li>Fix &#8211; Prevent Clipboard Javascript from loading all over the place on <code>/wp-admin/</code> [129526]</li>

<h4>[4.9.0] 2019-04-17</h4>
<ul>
<li>Feature &#8211; Refactor the Database Connection to start using an Object Relational Mapping tool for a better tested codebase</li>
<li>Feature &#8211; Add the <code>tribe_events()</code> function as entry-point to the Events ORM and the supporting filter code [116356, 115579]</li>
<li>Feature &#8211; Add the <code>tribe_venues()</code> function as entry-point to the Venues ORM and the supporting filter code [116356, 115579]</li>
<li>Feature &#8211; Add the <code>tribe_organizers()</code> function as entry-point to the Organizers ORM and the supporting filter code [116356, 115579]</li>
<li>Feature &#8211; Add additional caching to The Events Calendar REST API archives and the Post Repository event/venue/organizer responses [117159]</li>
<li>Feature &#8211; Include Freemius integration on to allow opt-in information collection for 10% of new users</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Setting the site of Timezones will trigger queries using UTC to equalize event dates on Views</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Add filter to allow deactivating Freemius <code>tribe_events_integrations_should_load_freemius</code></li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Include a way for third-party to handle Known Range rebuilding of events <code>tribe_events_rebuild_known_range</code></li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; All new granular handling for UTC and Timezone saving on the Classic editor</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Add support for the <code>tribe_suppress_query_filters</code> query variable to prevent the plugin&#8217;s own query filters from applying [116356, 115579]</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Add the <code>tribe_events_has_next_args</code> and <code>tribe_events_has_previous_args</code> filters to allow filtering the arguments that check if next/previous archive pages or events are available [123950]</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Include second param for the <code>the_title</code> for Events, Venue and Organizer Rest API endpoints amd prevent warnings. Props to Alex [123317]</li>
<li>Language &#8211; 5 new strings added, 167 updated, 0 fuzzied, and 1 obsoleted</li>
</ul>

<h4>[4.8.1] 2019-02-14</h4>
<ul>
<li>Feature &#8211; Introduced new &#8220;(do not override)&#8221; default post status for Eventbrite imports in Event Aggregator. This preserves events&#8217; original statuses from Eventbrite.com upon import (e.g., &#8220;draft&#8221; events will not be automatically set to &#8220;publish&#8221; upon import) [112346]</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Make sure the setting for &#8220;Default mobile view&#8221; is respected. Thanks to Kathleen, Tim and others for reporting this! [119271]</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Apply block closer to price block [120108]</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Added new filter <code>tribe_aggregator_new_event_post_status_before_import</code> to allow for custom handling of an event&#8217;s post status before EA an import is completed [112648]</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Added filters: <code>tribe_events_admin_js_ajax_url_data</code></li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Unload Image Widget Plus version 1.0.2 or older to Prevent it from creating fatals on The Events Calendar</li>
<li>Language &#8211; 2 new strings added, 150 updated, 1 fuzzied, and 0 obsoleted</li>
</ul>

<h4>[4.7.3] 2018-12-19</h4>
<ul>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Tweak the registration of the Event, Venue, and Organizer post types so they use some new post type labels introduced in WordPress 5.0 like <code>item_updated</code>, <code>item_scheduled</code>, etc. [119451]</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Password protected events breaking the month view. Thanks to Lindsay, Simon and others for flagging this out! [117385]</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Add proper capitalization for Event Price for Blocks Editor [119140]</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Make sure Datetime Format for Datepickers are respected on the Blocks Editor [117428]</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Correct text domain and remove old <code>events-gutenberg</code> [118656]</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Properly display recurrence description on Blocks Editor view [119354]</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Point support links to the correct places [117795]</li>
<li>Language &#8211; 27 new strings added, 106 updated, 0 fuzzied, and 13 obsoleted</li>
</ul>
<h4>[4.7.2] 2018-12-13</h4>
<ul>
<li>Feature &#8211; Added new action <code>tribe_events_before_event_template_data_date_display</code> and <code>tribe_events_after_event_template_data_date_display</code></li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Corrected font on time picker components in Event Date Time block [116907]</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Adjusted padding on the Event Date Time block [118697]</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Set default start time to 8:00am and default end time to 5:00pm in Event Date Time block [118112]</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Corrected an issue where feature detection of async-process support would fire too many requests [118876]</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Removed tribe_events_template_data()&#8217;s dependency on Events Calendar PRO, which could lead to a fatal error under some conditions [119263]</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Made the Event Date Time block respect the timezone settings [118682]</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Removed Price block dashboard gap [118683]</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Made sure all block editor code for Meta saving is PHP 5.2 compatible</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Prevented <code>undefined</code> from been displayed at the Event Date Time separator fields [119337]</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Solved 500 error when trying to update an event [118058]s</li>
</ul>
<h4>[4.7.1] 2018-12-05</h4>

<li>Feature &#8211; Added additional caching to TEC REST API archives and the Post Repository event/venue/organizer responses [117159]</li>

<li>Fix &#8211; Importing CSV files with whitespace at the beginning of the rows won&#8217;t remove headers and skip columns on Preview [117236]</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Prevent JavaScript error in Month View when the Date filter is removed from the Tribe Bar (thank you to @tyrann0us on GitHub for submitting this fix!) [116995]</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Facilitate automated updates for Events Calendar PRO even if it&#8217;s requirements have not been met</li>
</ul>
